A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Heartbreakingly bad. Rule 1\, if its a well known and loved character  destroy their legacy\, kill them\, do both or ignore them. Rule 2\, if its a new and potentially interesting character don't develop them\, kill them\, do both or regress them. 
Script abysmal. Main plot extremely boring and full of holes. Sub plots absolutely pointless\, tedious\, preachy and full of holes. Acting\, fair to excruciating. Excitement zero\, anticipation for next episode zero\, interest in what that kid will do with his broom non-existent. 
There's a Meerkat insurance advert that is more entertaining than the film it's referencing.
Just thankful i'm of the generation that got to see and appreciate the original Star Wars trilogy in all its glory.
